item.description:
Oh lordy, lordy, Judi is turning 50 Of course it's kind of hard to believe for she still looks 30. We'll celebrate this milestone in an absolutely fitting & gorgeous setting. See you there.

Wear Orange. This park allows hunting.

Christine


Only half an hour from Manchester, the 2 mile loop trail around Beaver Pond takes about an hour.
The trail book I have describes it as:

"In this section of Bear Brook State Park you'll find developed campsites in nicely pruned woods; a small open playing field; a cozy swimming beach; and an intriguing bird-filled marsh.
The yellow-blazed trail takes you all the way around Beaver Pond, with water in sight nearly the entire route. Except for a short pass over a rock outcrop, the well-maintained, clearly marked path remains relatively flat.
- the forested shore offers a sense of relaxing isolation.
- boardwalks help keep feet dry."


DIRECTIONS: from Deerfield Rd it is 6.3 miles to the Public Campground. SET your mileage meter when you turn onto Deerfield.

When you turn onto Deerfield Rd you will see signs within a quarter of a mile, the first of which indicates that all visitors must stop and check in (that's the nominal fee and you get a map too)

At 3 to 3.1 miles you will be taking a RIGHT, directly after an old cemetary.

At 3.3 miles (so .2 miles later) take a LEFT turn for the public campground.

Follow for 3 miles to the campground and you will see the check in lodge.

Hugo & I will be there to let you know where to park.

NOTE: anyone interested in carpooling from Manchester please EMAIL me ASAP.
My car can host 2-3 people, plus Hugo & 2-3 smaller dogs.

Meetup is at 10:30 am at the campground entrance
